description: Integrate @coderef/core scanner functions directly into coderef-dashboard via Next.js API routes, replacing CLI subprocess calls with fast, type-safe access

orchestrator.role: Synthesize both agent plans into unified implementation roadmap
orchestrator.notes: ✅ Comprehensive orchestrator plan created. Synthesized 13 tasks from both agents (6 packages + 7 dashboard). Identified critical path, parallelization opportunities, 5 risks with mitigations, and optimal execution strategy. Timeline: 14-21 hours total (optimistic: 14h, realistic: 17.5h, pessimistic: 21h). Key deliverables: dependency analysis, integration points, risk register, validation checklist, success criteria.

agents.notes: ✅ ALL TASKS COMPLETE. PKG-001: Verified exports (scanCurrentElements, ElementData, ScanOptions in dist/index.d.ts). PKG-002: Created API-SCANNER-CONTRACT.md (comprehensive 800+ line documentation). PKG-003: Verified TypeScript declarations. PKG-004: Created scanner-standalone.test.ts (22 tests, Next.js simulation). PKG-005: Documented error handling (ENOENT, EACCES, validation). PKG-006: Created nextjs-api-route.ts example (full POST/GET implementation with SSE streaming). Ready for dashboard integration.

âœ… Found 12 resource sheets. Created comprehensive Phase 1 plan with 7 tasks for integrating @coderef/core scanner via new /api/scan endpoint. Plan includes: dependency setup, API route creation, ScanApi client module, ScanExecutor refactor, UI updates, testing, and docs. Estimated effort: 10-15 hours.
